p: Additionally, carrageenan-induced paw edema leads to sensitization of primary sensory neurons, essentially event to inflammatory pain [ 90]. In humans, this nociceptor sensitization usually leads to clinical conditions known as hyperalgesia defined as an increased response to a painful stimulus or allodynia described as pain evoked by non-noxious stimuli. In our study, we have proven that oral administration of cashew nuts 30 min before CAR, was in grade to reduce hyperalgesia and allodynia significantly at 6 h post-CAR.
